website_summaries.verdict: A budget set of bore bars with a lighter touch to work on soft metals like aluminum.
pros: 9-piece set features various bar lengths and diameters for different bore holes
Carbide tip is gentle enough to work with softer metals without destroying the finished product
cons: Cutting heads require a light touch with minimal pressure while boring into hard metals

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to grind carbide
customer_reviews.text: Use can be extracted from these if you have the equipment and time required to get them to a correct shape. As received, they are basically useless for anything harder than a stick of butter. After working on a couple with diamond for a while, I was able to get passable performance with aluminum and steel.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Gullbury

customer_reviews.title: Carbide is good quality, no chipping (mild steel), needed some of the clearance angles reground
customer_reviews.text: Carbide is good quality, no chipping (mild steel), needed some of the clearance angles reground
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: good product-
customer_reviews.text: Received the boring tool set & satisfied with the look of the tools & grinding of the carbide surfaces- I'm sure they can be used as received -with out touch up grinding - Good value for price of the set- Thanks- Dave Richardson
customer_reviews.author: Dave Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate packaging, chipped cutting edges
customer_reviews.text: I knew something was wrong when I picked up the box on delivery. I could hear tools rattling around and when I opened the box several of the tools had chipped cutting edges from bumping into each other. They are carbide tipped and carbide is very brittle. I can not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Payne

customer_reviews.title: Good value for hobby type machining
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set because I needed to finish bore a hole in aluminum in my garage hobby shop. I only used the single largest and longest boring bar and it worked reasonably well. Deflection seemed to not be a problem and the quality of my machined surface was great. Good value for the hobby machinist working with softer metals.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Frame

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: Decent for the money for sure served the purpose of boring out sprocket ids and easily re ground
customer_reviews.author: Blaze

customer_reviews.title: without spending a hell of a lot more for anything better.
customer_reviews.text: Just cheap entry level bore bars that will most home machinist doing hobby type stuff can get by with, without spending a hell of a lot more for anything better.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Laboursoliere

customer_reviews.title: Not boring
customer_reviews.text: Not extreme industrial but good for the home shop if used sensibly.
customer_reviews.author: Thanks from Jim

customer_reviews.title: worked for me.
customer_reviews.text: i have only used one of these so far but it worked good and did what it was supposed to do. if i need more of these i will order from this company again. they were oiled good and no bad places on them.
customer_reviews.author: Diehard

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set,
customer_reviews.text: They all are as expected, sharp enough to use out of the box. Very nice set,
customer_reviews.author: Jan Kent

customer_reviews.title: Not terrible but need a bit of fine tuning
customer_reviews.text: They do work but to really be usable you need to relieve them. Cut decent so far
customer_reviews.author: rickybobby07

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Only tried one of the 9, but it worked well and the others look good.
customer_reviews.author: AJB

customer_reviews.title: Work fine
customer_reviews.text: These are obviously Chinese made/finished, but they work fine. Carbide hasn't chipped yet so I think definitely a good buy for general use..
customer_reviews.author: Scott (Technogeek)Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to be well built, did the job I bought them for.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly well made
customer_reviews.text: Great bits especially for the money. The shafts are quite rigid and have seen no chatter even on the longest (3") bit on steel. Very happy with purchase. Carbide is brazed cleanly and quite large for long life. Will buy again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: BCStargazer

customer_reviews.title: Beware the grind.
customer_reviews.text: Many of these have a bad grind on the carbide, and you'll need to fix that before they will cut properly. You get what you pay for here.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN D ROBERTSON

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: this set is a good product for the price. i would recommend this set to a friend and delivery time was good
customer_reviews.author: Dan Petroski

customer_reviews.title: boring bar set
customer_reviews.text: I've not had occasion to use these yet====but they appear to be very good quality and are very sharp I am not an expert lathe user so I might have preferred a square shank which would 'locate' them at the correct cutting angle. These are obviously designed to use in a different kind of holder than I am familiar with
customer_reviews.author: Deseret Rider

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice tools for the price, had to make a holder though.
customer_reviews.author: Robert V Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not useable out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed when I went to use these because I had to regrind them to get proper clearance and a clean cutting edge. They are sturdy and very useable, once the cutting edge was sharpened and proper clearance angles were ground.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Roberts

customer_reviews.title: boring bars
customer_reviews.text: the product was like it was described. im pleased with this item. that's all im going to say about this item.
customer_reviews.author: FRANK PATTERSON

customer_reviews.title: they are ok for the price. don't try to ...
customer_reviews.text: they are ok for the price. don't try to force them or they just bend they would be ok on a mini lathe or mill.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

product_meta.title: 1/2" Boring BAR Set PRO Quality 9 PCS Carbide Tipped Bars 1/2" Shank Lathe Tool
product_meta.description: 1/2" BORING BAR SET PRO QUALITY 9 PCS CARBIDE TIPPED BARS 1/2" SHANK LATHE TOOL
feature_bullets: 9 Piece boring bar set features C-6 carbide for use in harder materials but also works great in aluminum and other soft metals All shanks are held to 0.0000-0.0005" from the nominal diameter and made of special heat treated alloy steel. Shank Diameter- 1/2".
Contains: (3) pcs. 5/16" minimum bore (1 ea. 3/4" bore depth x 2-1/4" overall, 1 ea. 1-1/8" x 2-5/8", & 1 ea. 1-1/2" x 3");

Contains: (3) pcs. 7/16" minimum bore (1 ea. 1-1/8" bore depth x 2-5/8" overall, 1 ea. 1-11/16" x 3-3/16", & 1 ea. 2-1/4" x 3-3/4"), (3) pcs. 9/16" minimum bore (1 ea. 1-1/2" bore depth x 3" overall, 1 ea. 2-1/4" x 3-3/4", & 1 ea. 3" x 4-1/2")

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars66 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
